body:
Doing a little more poking around:

```env={"AV_LOG_FORCE_COLOR": "TRUE", "PATH": os.environ["PATH"]},```

This works on Linux to keep your color settings in the env for the callouts as well as getting the right path, not sure if this is portable on Windows though.
Interesting discovery. I've always been using v2x on my Arch so I should, theoretically work. I'm also on 3.10.4. Where's your FFmpeg and how is it installed?

It was a source build from their site and I plunked the trio of binaries in my user path `$HOME/bin/`

To give a little more context, sorry the first comment was probably more conversational than helpful:

PATH Info and ffmpeg versions from the active virtualenv:
```(video2x) steve@kimmy:~/Videos/upscale_tests$ which ffmpeg
/home/steve/bin/ffmpeg

(video2x) steve@kimmy:~/Videos/upscale_tests$ ls -l /home/steve/bin/ff*
-rwxr-xr-x 1 steve steve 22857880 Apr  5 15:16 /home/steve/bin/ffmpeg
-rwxr-xr-x 1 steve steve 22718584 Apr  5 15:16 /home/steve/bin/ffplay
-rwxr-xr-x 1 steve steve 22756024 Apr  5 15:16 /home/steve/bin/ffprobe

(video2x) steve@kimmy:~/Videos/upscale_tests$ ffmpeg

ffmpeg version N-106509-g21ca221068 Copyright (c) 2000-2022 the FFmpeg developers
  built with gcc 11 (Ubuntu 11.2.0-19ubuntu1)
  configuration: --prefix=/opt/ffmpeg/build --pkg-config-flags=--static --extra-cflags=-I/opt/ffmpeg/build/include --extra-ldflags=-L/opt/ffmpeg/build/lib --extra-libs='-lpthread -lm' --ld=g++ --bindir=/opt/ffmpeg/bin --disable-shared --enable-gpl --enable-gnutls --enable-libass --enable-libfdk-aac --enable-libfreetype --enable-libmp3lame --enable-libopus --enable-libvorbis --enable-libx264 --enable-libx265 --enable-pic --enable-nonfree
  libavutil      57. 24.101 / 57. 24.101
  libavcodec     59. 25.100 / 59. 25.100
  libavformat    59. 20.101 / 59. 20.101
  libavdevice    59.  6.100 / 59.  6.100
  libavfilter     8. 30.100 /  8. 30.100
  libswscale      6.  6.100 /  6.  6.100
  libswresample   4.  6.100 /  4.  6.100
  libpostproc    56.  5.100 / 56.  5.100
Hyper fast Audio and Video encoder
usage: ffmpeg [options] [[infile options] -i infile]... {[outfile options] outfile}...

Use -h to get full help or, even better, run 'man ffmpeg'

(video2x) steve@kimmy:~/Videos/upscale_tests$ echo $PATH
*/home/steve/bin*:/home/steve/.pyenv/plugins/pyenv-virtualenv/shims:/home/steve/.pyenv/shims:/home/steve/.pyenv/bin:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games:/snap/bin
```

Running the unmodified version:
```
(video2x) steve@kimmy:~/Videos/upscale_tests$ VK_ICD_FILENAMES=/usr/share/vulkan/icd.d/radeon_icd.x86_64.json video2x -i title_t01.mkv -o v2x_test2.mkv upscale -w 1920 -h 1080 -a srmd
06:42:14.901693 | INFO     | Video2X 5.0.0-beta5
06:42:14.901838 | INFO     | Copyright (C) 2018-2022 K4YT3X and contributors.
06:42:14.901921 | INFO     | Reading input video information
06:42:14.925177 | INFO     | Starting video decoder
06:42:14.927052 | ERROR    | [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'ffmpeg'
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/video2x/bin/video2x", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
    |   |    -> <function main at 0x7f49145b0670>
    |   -> <built-in function exit>
    -> <module 'sys' (built-in)>
> File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/envs/video2x/lib/python3.10/site-packages/video2x/video2x.py", line 612, in main
    video2x.upscale(
    |       -> <function Video2X.upscale at 0x7f49145b0550>
    -> <video2x.video2x.Video2X object at 0x7f491473aad0>
  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/envs/video2x/lib/python3.10/site-packages/video2x/video2x.py", line 412, in upscale
    self._run(
    |    -> <function Video2X._run at 0x7f49145b04c0>
    -> <video2x.video2x.Video2X object at 0x7f491473aad0>
  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/envs/video2x/lib/python3.10/site-packages/video2x/video2x.py", line 220, in _run
    self.decoder = VideoDecoder(
    |              -> <class 'video2x.decoder.VideoDecoder'>
    -> <video2x.video2x.Video2X object at 0x7f491473aad0>
  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/envs/video2x/lib/python3.10/site-packages/video2x/decoder.py", line 80, in __init__
    self.decoder = subprocess.Popen(
    |              |          -> <class 'subprocess.Popen'>
    |              -> <module 'subprocess' from '/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/lib/python3.10/subprocess.py'>
    -> <VideoDecoder(Thread-1, initial)>
  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/lib/python3.10/subprocess.py", line 966, in __init__
    self._execute_child(args, executable, preexec_fn, close_fds,
    |    |              |     |           |           -> True
    |    |              |     |           -> None
    |    |              |     -> None
    |    |              -> ['ffmpeg', '-r', '23.976023976023978', '-i', PosixPath('title_t01.mkv'), '-map', '0:v', '-f', 'rawvideo', '-pix_fmt', 'rgb24'...
    |    -> <function Popen._execute_child at 0x7f494158e320>
    -> <Popen: returncode: 255 args: ['ffmpeg', '-r', '23.976023976023978', '-i', P...>
  File "/home/steve/.pyenv/versions/3.10.4/lib/python3.10/subprocess.py", line 1842, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename)
          |                    |          |        -> 'ffmpeg'
          |                    |          -> 'No such file or directory'
          |                    -> 2
          -> <class 'OSError'>

FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'ffmpeg'
```

I've pushed a fix. Try it out.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/162566461-0d81eeef-15c2-46a3-91a4-f6af819d0639.png)
This one's working on my end, thanks for the patch!
